intro: Draba dubia var. delessertii, commonly known as the Delessert's wintercress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, glaucous leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a single terminal inflorescence, typically blooming in early spring. It is native to alpine and arctic regions of Europe and Asia, thriving in rocky and gravelly soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
